definition: to assign/to allocate/to transfer (money to an account)
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch

sentences.english: In the end, a substantial transfer from Saudi Arabia closed the gap.
sentences.chinese: 最终，由沙特阿拉伯划拨的大量资金弥补了这一差额。

sentences.english: The loans would come from already-appropriated money.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将来自已经划拨的资金。

sentences.english: New-hope company was founded by executive means.
sentences.chinese: 新希望公司是一个以行政划拨方式成立的公司。

sentences.english: A large sum has been allocated for buying new books for the library.
sentences.chinese: 已经划拨一大笔款子给图书馆购买新书。

sentences.english: There is no issue of identification in specific goods.
sentences.chinese: 特定物不存在划拨问题。

sentences.english: The Indonesian government said it had approved 26 million dollars in cash to help victims.
sentences.chinese: 印尼政府称它刚刚为灾民划拨了二千六百万美元现金。

sentences.english: Shares registered as emerging stocks must be transferred by book entry.
sentences.chinese: 登录兴柜股份应以帐簿划拨方式交付。

sentences.english: OTC-listed shares must use the book-entry transfer method of delivery.
sentences.chinese: 上柜股份应以帐簿划拨方式交付。

sentences.english: The ford foundation allocated millions of dollars for cancer research.
sentences.chinese: 福特基金为癌症的研究划拨数百万美元。

sentences.english: The interest factors are proper access to the research on the legislation of large-value electronic funds transfer.
sentences.chinese: 利益因素是研究大额电子资金划拨法的一个切入点。

sentences.english: Moreover, the 30 acres of land belonging to the allocation of land.
sentences.chinese: 此外，在30英亩的土地属于划拨土地。

sentences.english: Commercialization of assigned land is the focal point of land use system reform.
sentences.chinese: 划拨土地市场化是目前城镇土地使用制度改革的重点。

sentences.english: A large sum of money has been allocated for buying books for the library.
sentences.chinese: 一大笔钱已划拨给图书馆买新书。

sentences.english: Greater problems in the allocation of land to build public houses by.
sentences.chinese: 更大的问题在划拨土地所建的公房上。

definition: to transfer (income, profits etc) to higher authorities
special fund/money allocated for a particular purpose
to distribute/to assign/to allocate/to partition (a hard drive)
